main event: Radar tracked an unidentified object flying southeast to northwest in a U-curve over Farmington, New Mexico in 1960.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar for 5-10 minutes, displaying high speed and the ability to change course abruptly.
A ground observer also visually sighted the object, describing it as a round ball of green fire.
The object was estimated to be approximately 2,000 yards in size.
No sound was reported associated with the object.
A separate report described three luminous, hovering objects observed in the area on a different date, also traveling at high speed.
sighted object: round ball of green fire, unidentified object tracked on radar
